title: All folders become unsubscribed, the subscribe them all again
content:
Using Mozilla 115.4.2 (64-bit) on MacOS 14.0

I have plenty of folders and subfolders on my Office365 account (institutional) that I access using Thundebird.

When I reorganise my emails, moving messages from the Inbox to other folders, create new folders, rename folders etc. Thunderbird loses the subscription settings. At its first launch after such reorganization, I see only few folders, so I need to subscribe again to all my subfolders.

Questions: subscribing to almost all of the subfolders is painful.

Would you be so kind to add an option "subscribe all folders", so a user can only select those folders that need to be unsubscribed?
creator: lordthistle

I can only see the setup page. Help!

title: No mail updates (and nothing happening on send/receive button) until restart of Thunderbird
content:
It happens repeatedly, several times per day (usually after resuming from hibernation, also sometimes after changing networks or just "out of the blue"), that Thunderbird will just stop getting new mails.

When I click the send/receive button in this state, nothing happens (nothing gets shown in the status bar either).

Looking into the error console, I can sometimes (not always) find an error like what's shown in the attached screenshot.

A restart of Thunderbird fixes the problem.

What can I do to stop this from happening?

I'm on Windows 10, and I have both an Gmail account and another non-Gmail IMAP account.

title: Thunderbird editor fonts
content: The latest version of Thunderbird shows fonts in the editor window much smaller than they actually are. Was working fine until the most recent update to version 115. I'm using Thunderbird on Linux Mint 20.2 64 bit, with Mate 1.24.0. See images. 'Actual font size' shows what the text looks like in the preview window and as it shows when received (tested with a gmail account on a phone). The 'Small font display' image shows the same text in the editor window (used reply to illustrate). Something has gone seriously pear shaped here. To send an email with the receiver getting fonts at a reasonable size, I now have to write the email using tiny text on screen or compose the message in a text editor and paste it in. I've tried searching for a solution and implementing suggestions relating to density and config-editor without success. (Looks like a bug. Smells like a bug. Waddles like a bug) Any solution, please. Kevin
creator: kevin242

title: Thunderbird update sorts search results by thread not by date
content: I have been using Thunderbird for many years, and really like it - until two recent updates (sorry!). I am running Ubuntu 22.04, and Thunderbird 115.4.1. One now has a column taken on the left which is unnecessary, and a section at the top which is above the menus with e.g. File... but I would like my File menu at the top, as it used to be. The second issue is more frustrating - the search facility, where one can find the emails being sought, allows me to search by many options, and I was able to display the results sorted by subject, size or my normal was by date, but I never use the message threads as that is rarely of interest, and I can sort on that using the message subject if needed. Now, when I search the results are ONLY in the message threads, and if I try to sort by date, I lose all information, and the ONLY option is to see the messages by thread which is no use to me! How can I restore good old Thunderbird - the version I enjoy using (or have the functionality I had restored)?! Many thanks,
creator: trevortmanson

title: Leaving Thunderbord on Overnight and resuming work the next day, The tabs will not stay saved and open
content: I work with my tabs a lot. When I open an attachment, Thunderbird opens a new tab and buts the content of the attachment (pdf) into a new tab. Often I need to save my work and stop working that day, and just let my computer go into sleep mode with Thunderbird still open in windows. In the previous versions, I could just start working the next day, and all my tabs are populated with the attachments and information I left open the day before. With this new update 115.4.2 (32-bit) it does not retain any of the information in any of the tabs that were previously left open. It only happens when the computer has been sleeping overnight or for an extended period of time. If I put the computer to sleep and then wake it up pretty quickly it keeps the tabs just fine. Very frustrating
creator: finance41

content:

I have set up , as far as I can tell, correctly, the password on the account works for incoming mail. The default smtp server for this mailbox is correct: smtp.office.365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2 and my correct mail address for this account. Any thoughts as to what I am not doing?

TIA

Duncan

creator: vbivell

title: Moving messages between accounts using Message Filters
content:
I'm using Thunderbird 115.4.1 on a Windows machine. I have two IMAP accounts configured.

I set up a message filter rule to move messages from the Inbox to a specific folder based upon the subject. That works fine. Then I changed to rule to instead move the message to a folder on a different account. That doesn't work.

I can manually copy the email from the original account to the second account with no problem. So, Thunderbird has no problem moving a message from one account to another. But, it's not doing that when using a Message Filters rule.

I did look at the filter log. Thunderbird is applying the filter to the message.

When I edited the rule to specify to move the message to a different account, Thunderbird listed both accounts and allowed me to select the folder on the second account. That would seem to indicate that such an operation is valid. So, is this problem a known limitation or issue with Thunderbird?

Does anyone know of any workaround?
creator: mozilla474

title: Last couple of weeks Thunderbird frequently hangs (never-ending blue spinning circle)
content:
Been using Thunderbird for years, seldom have problems. But starting to see the software frequently hanging in the last week or two. Most often, things will be fine, and I'll go to bed. When I wake up, the software is hanging, no messages have been downloaded for hours, the cursor is a small blue spinning circle, and the program is not responding. I have to force-quit with task manager, start it up again, then it runs fine for several hours, before doing the same thing again. Just now, I found it hung again, without having to go to bed first.

I have no way of knowing if any email is being lost during this time or not, but I have no reason to think it is. The problem is not anything major (force quit, then reload is not a horrible inconvenience), but I'd like to avoid the problem.

Only recent change is I created a new gmail account because one place I like to receive emails from seems to be having problems with my own domains' emails, but they don't work with the gmail account either ... go figure. The new gmail account seems to have no problems sending or receiving emails for the most part, but since this problem started happening within the last couple of weeks, and I added the new email in the last couple of weeks, could be connected.
creator: jon135
